item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I just can't listen to any more Wagner, you know...I'm starting to get the urge to conquer Poland." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Is sex dirty? Only when it's being done right." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "A deranged person is supposed to have the strength of ten men. I have the strength of one small boy... with polio." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "My one regret in life is that I am not someone else." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I've had a perfectly wonderful evening, but this wasn't it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "A man is only as old as the woman he feels." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "A lady came up to me one day and said 'Sir! You are drunk', to which I replied 'I am drunk today madam, and tomorrow I shall be sober but you will still be ugly." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Winston Churchill
item.description: "...But the Mahommedan religion increases, instead of lessening, the fury of intolerance. It was originally propagated by the sword, and ever since, its votaries have been subject, above the people of all other creeds, to this form of madness. In a moment the fruits of patient toil, the prospects of material prosperity, the fear of death itself, are flung aside. The more emotional Pathans are powerless to resist. All rational considerations are forgotten. Seizing their weapons, they become Ghazis—as dangerous and as sensible as mad dogs: fit only to be treated as such. While the more generous spirits among the tribesmen become convulsed in an ecstasy of religious bloodthirstiness, poorer and more material souls derive additional impulses from the influence of others, the hopes of plunder and the joy of fighting. Thus whole nations are roused to arms. Thus the Turks repel their enemies, the Arabs of the Soudan break the British squares, and the rising on the Indian frontier spreads far and wide. In each case civilisation is confronted with militant Mahommedanism. The forces of progress clash with those of reaction. The religion of blood and war is face to face with that of peace." -- Winston Churchill

item.title: Inspectorleet add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description:
"Many forms of Government have been tried, and will be tried in this world of sin and woe. No one pretends that democracy is perfect or all-wise. Indeed, it has been said that democracy is the worst form of Government except for all those other forms that have been tried from time to time."
(Speech in the House of Commons, 11 November 1947)" -- Winston S. Churchill
